physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Thyroid antibodies were negative. Ultrasound revealed an enlarged thyroid gland, and serum thyroglobulin was elevated (72 ng/ml; normal /H1102155).
Detailed audiological examination showed thresholds at 55 dB (right ear) and 50 dB (left) on auditory brainstem response analysis, consistent with bilateral moderate hearing loss.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Auditory brainstem response thresholds improved to 30 dB (right) and 40 dB (left) at 13 months.
Compared to earlier assessments, hearing thresholds were closer to normal at this time.
